headline.main: OIL WELLS WRECKED, SAYS JAVA OFFICIAL; Japanese Forced to Make Fuel Substitutes, He Declares

lead_paragraph: Application of the scorched earth policy so wrecked the oil wells of Java that the Japanese invaders have been forced to plan the manufacture of a substitute fuel made from sugar and rubber instead of exploiting the mineral resources of the island, a former Netherlands Indies official said yesterday.
abstract: Dr P A Kasteel to serve as Gov; arrives, NYC
snippet: Application of the scorched earth policy so wrecked the oil wells of Java that the Japanese invaders have been forced to plan the manufacture of a substitute fuel made from sugar and rubber instead of exploiting the mineral resources of the island...
